title: Fortify Hex
description:
Your command your engineers to construct a protected encampment, such as a fort or barbican, to serve as a defensive post in the hex. Spend RP as determined by the hexâ€™s most inhospitable terrain:

  • Mountains:
  • Swamps:
  • Forests:
  • Hills:
  • Plains:

Then attempt a basic check. A fortified hex grants an additional bonus in warfare (see Appendix 3), but also gives traveling PCs a place to rest that prevents wandering monsters from interrupting their rest.
requirement: The target hex must be claimed by your kingdom and must not have a settlement in it.

criticalSuccess.msg: You find a defensible position for your fortification and finish construction efficiently. Gain a refund of half the RP you spent to build in the hex, then <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Lose 1 Unrest</button>

success.msg: You establish your fortification in the hex. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Lose 1 Unrest</button>

failure.msg: You fail to fortify the hex.

criticalFailure.msg: Your attempt ends in disaster. Not only do you fail to build a structure, but you lose several workers to an accident, banditry, a vicious monster, or some other unforeseen occurrence. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Gain 1 Unrest</button>
